curam.util.common.message
Class CatalogMessageLocalizer

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.common.message.CatalogMessageLocalizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageLocalizer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CustomMessageLocalizer
public class CatalogMessageLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageLocalizer, java.io.Serializable

A message localizer providing safe, internationalized access to message catalog files (properties files). It localizes messages by looking up the message identifier in the catalog configured during instantiation. It reports errors when catalogs cannot be found, when messages cannot be found within catalogs, or when the entire messaging system appears to be mis-configured.

See Also:

CatalogMessageLocalizer

public CatalogMessageLocalizer(java.lang.String catalogName,
                               java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)

Create a new catalog-based message localizer.

When loading a catalog, the given class loader will be used to locate the catalog on the classpath. This in useful when this class is loaded by a class loader that is an ancestor of the class loader to which the catalog is visible. With no ability to specify a class loader, that catalog would not be found. For example, it is possible to have a J2EE application where the web application WAR file contains the catalog and this message localizer class is present on the classpath of the EAR file containing the WAR file. Typically, the class loader configuration for that deployment would mean that "EAR class loader" could not see any classes or catalogs available to the "WAR class loader". Therefore, the code in the web application should initialize this message localizer with its own class loader. The parent-first delegation mechanism still applies, so this cannot be used to override catalogs with the same name on the parent class loader.

Parameters:
catalogName - The name of the message catalog.
classLoader - The class loader to use when locating catalogs. May be null, if the class loader of this class is to be used.
